intro: Ranunculus pianmaensis, commonly known as the Pianma buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan Province in China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are typically palmately divided, and its flowers have numerous stamens and a prominent pistil. It thrives in moist, cool environments and is often found in forest understories or along streams. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
